Constructor Detail

init

public init([any config='[runtime expression]'])
Constructor This creates a connection to a Couchbase server using the passed in config argument, which can be a struct literal of options, a path to a config object or an instance of a cfcouchbase.config.CouchbaseConfig object. For all the possible config settings, look at the CouchbaseConfig object.

Parameters:
config - The configuration structure, config object or path to a config object.

add

public any add(string ID, any value, [numeric timeout], [any persistTo], [any replicateTo])
This method is the same as set(), except the future that is returned will return true if the ID being set doesn't already exist. The future will return false if the item being set does already exist. It will not throw an error if the ID already exists, you must check the future. This function returns a Java OperationFuture object (net.spy.memcached.internal.OperationFuture) or void (null) if a timeout exception occurs.

Parameters:
ID - yes
value - yes
timeout - The expiration of the document in minutes, by default it is 0, so it lives forever
persistTo - The number of nodes that need to store the document to disk before this call returns. Use the this.peristTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, MASTER, ONE, TWO, THREE ]
replicateTo - The number of nodes to replicate the document to before this call returns. Use the this.replicateTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, ONE, TWO, THREE ]

asyncDecr

public any asyncDecr(string ID, numeric value)
Decrement the given counter asynchronously,a future with the decremented value, or -1 if the decrement failed.

Parameters:
ID - The id of the document to decrement
value - The amount to decrement

asyncIncr

public any asyncIncr(string ID, numeric value)
Increment the given counter asynchronously,a future with the incremented value, or -1 if the increment failed.

Parameters:
ID - The id of the document to decrement
value - The amount to decrement

buildCouchbaseClient

private any buildCouchbaseClient(CouchbaseConfig config)
Buid a couchbase connection client according to config and returns the raw java connection client object

Parameters:
config

decr

public any decr(string ID, numeric value, [numeric defaultValue='0'], [numeric timeout])
Decrement the given counter, returning the new value. Due to the way the memcached server operates on items, incremented and decremented items will be returned as Strings with any operations that return a value. This function returns the new value, or -1 if we were unable to decrement or add

Parameters:
ID - The id of the document to decrement
value - The amount to decrement
defaultValue - The default value ( if the counter does not exist, this defaults to 0 );
timeout - The expiration of the document in minutes, by default it is 0, so it lives forever

defaultPersistReplicate

private CouchbaseClient defaultPersistReplicate(any args)
Default persist and replicate from arguments

Parameters:
args

delete

public any delete(any ID, [any persistTo], [any replicateTo])
Delete a value with durability options. The durability options here operate similarly to those documented in the set method. This function returns a Java OperationFuture object (net.spy.memcached.internal.OperationFuture) or a struct of futures

Parameters:
ID - The ID of the document to delete, or an array of ID's to delete
persistTo - The number of nodes that need to store the document to disk before this call returns. Use the this.peristTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, MASTER, ONE, TWO, THREE ]
replicateTo - The number of nodes to replicate the document to before this call returns. Use the this.replicateTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, ONE, TWO, THREE ]

flush

public any flush([numeric delay='0'])
Flush all caches from all servers with a delay of application. Returns a future object

Parameters:
delay - The period of time to delay, in seconds

get

public any get(string ID)
Get an object from couchbase, returns null if not found.

Parameters:
ID - The ID of the document to retrieve.

getDocStats

public any getDocStats(any ID)
Get stats from a document and return a future or a struct of futures.

Parameters:
ID - The id of the document to get the stats for or a list or an array

getJava

public any getJava(any className)
Get an instance of a java class

Parameters:
className - The class to get

getJavaLoader

public any getJavaLoader()
Get the java loader instance

getLibJars

getStats

public any getStats([string stat])
Get all of the stats from all of the connections, each key of the returned struct is a java java.net.InetSocketAddress object

Parameters:
stat - The key of an individual stat to return

incr

public any incr(string ID, numeric value, [numeric defaultValue='0'], [numeric timeout])
Increment the given counter, returning the new value. Due to the way the memcached server operates on items, incremented and decremented items will be returned as Strings with any operations that return a value. This function returns the new value, or -1 if we were unable to increment or add

Parameters:
ID - The id of the document to increment
value - The amount to increment
defaultValue - The default value ( if the counter does not exist, this defaults to 0 );
timeout - The expiration of the document in minutes, by default it is 0, so it lives forever

loadSDK

private any loadSDK()
Load JavaLoader with the SDK

replace

public any replace(string ID, any value, [numeric timeout], [any persistTo], [any replicateTo])
This method will set a value only if that ID already exists in Couchbase. If the document ID doesn't exist, it will do nothing. This function returns a Java OperationFuture object (net.spy.memcached.internal.OperationFuture) or void (null) if a timeout exception occurs. future.get() will return true if the replace was successfull, and will return false if the ID didn't already exist to replace.

Parameters:
ID - The ID of the document to replace.
value - The value of the document to replace
timeout - The expiration of the document in minutes, by default it is 0, so it lives forever
persistTo - The number of nodes that need to store the document to disk before this call returns. Use the this.peristTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, MASTER, ONE, TWO, THREE ]
replicateTo - The number of nodes to replicate the document to before this call returns. Use the this.replicateTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, ONE, TWO, THREE ]

set

public any set(string ID, any value, [numeric timeout], [any persistTo], [any replicateTo])
Set a value with durability options. It is asyncronouse by default so it returns immediatley without waiting for the actual set to complete. Call future.set() if you need to confirm the document has been set. Even then, the document is only guarunteed to be in memory on a single node. To force the document to be replicated to additional nodes, pass the replicateTo argument. A value of ReplicateTo.TWO ensures the document is copied to at least two replica nodes, etc. (This assumes you have replicas enabled) To force the document to be perisited to disk, passing in PersistTo.ONE ensures it is stored on disk in a single node. PersistTo.TWO ensures 2 nodes, etc. A PersistTo.TWO durability setting implies a replication to at least one node. This function returns a Java OperationFuture object (net.spy.memcached.internal.OperationFuture) or void (null) if a timeout exception occurs.

Parameters:
ID - The unique id of the document to store
value - The value to store
timeout - The expiration of the document in minutes, by default it is 0, so it lives forever
persistTo - The number of nodes that need to store the document to disk before this call returns. Use the this.peristTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, MASTER, ONE, TWO, THREE ]
replicateTo - The number of nodes to replicate the document to before this call returns. Use the this.replicateTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, ONE, TWO, THREE ]

setMulti

public any setMulti(struct data, [numeric timeout], [any persistTo], [any replicateTo])
Set multiple documents in the cache with a single operation. Pass in a struct of documents to set where the IDs of the struct are the document IDs. The values in the struct are the values being set. All documents share the same timout, persistTo, and replicateTo settings. This function returns a struct of IDs with each of the future objects from the set operations. There will be no future object if a timeout occurs.

Parameters:
data - A struct (key/value pair) of documents to set into Couchbase.
timeout - The expiration of the documents in minutes.
persistTo - The number of nodes that need to store the document to disk before this call returns. Use the this.peristTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, MASTER, ONE, TWO, THREE ]
replicateTo - The number of nodes to replicate the document to before this call returns. Use the this.replicateTo enum on this object for values [ ZERO, ONE, TWO, THREE ]

shutdown

public CouchbaseClient shutdown([numeric timeout='10'])
Shutdown the native client connection

Parameters:
timeout - The timeout in seconds, we default to 10 seconds

touch

public any touch(string ID, numeric timeout)
Touch the given key to reset its expiration time. This method returns a future

Parameters:
ID - The id of the document to increment
timeout - The expiration of the document in minutes

validateConfig

private CouchbaseConfig validateConfig(any config)
Standardize and validate configuration object

Parameters:
config - The config options as a struct, path or instance.
